definition: A term used to describe the action of two or more entities engaging in a reciprocal or mutual activity, often involving movement or interaction in opposite directions or in opposition to each other. It is commonly used to describe the simultaneous or parallel actions of individuals or objects that are in close proximity to each other.

examples.english: They played football against each other.

examples.german: Die beiden Teams kämpften gegeneinander um den Titel.
examples.english: The two teams competed against each other for the title.
The siblings argued with each other.

examples.german: Die beiden Länder stehen gegeneinander im Handelskrieg.
examples.english: The two countries are engaged in a trade war against each other.
The teams played fair against each other.
